thread.title: Malcolm Turnbull's disability gambit backfires, drawing fire from Paralympian Kurt Fearnley
thread.title_full: Malcolm Turnbull's disability gambit backfires, drawing fire from Paralympian Kurt Fearnley

author: Adam Gartrell
title: Malcolm Turnbull's disability gambit backfires, drawing fire from Paralympian Kurt Fearnley
text:
Turnbull savings plan in tatters Turnbull savings plan in tatters 
The Labor party and crossbenchers are banding together to thwart the government's plan to increase childcare funding that means cuts to other welfare payments. More videos Xenophon won't back welfare changes 
The government's omnibus savings bill has met with resistance, with Senator Nick Xenophon declaring his party won't vote for the legislation. 
But crossbench kingmaker Nick Xenophon officially torpedoed the plan on Tuesday, saying the trade-off was simply "too harsh". 
"As a negotiating tactic, this is as subtle as a sledgehammer. Pitting battling Australians against Australians needing disability support services is dumb policy and even dumber politics," Senator Xenophon said. Related Content Xenophon blocks $4 billion omnibus bill 
The government - which needs all three of Senator Xenophon's upper house votes to pass legislation opposed by Labor and the Greens - would need to go "back to the drawing board", he said. 
Treasurer Scott Morrison and Social Services Minister Christian Porter are refusing to give up on the bill - which contains cuts to family tax benefits, paid parental leave and other payments - and are continuing to lobby the crossbench. Advertisement 
Government sources said it had "positive" signals from One Nation but without Senator Xenophon's support, the bill appears doomed. 
Paralympic wheelchair-racing legend Kurt Fearnley was furious about the government's move, accusing it of using the NDIS as a "political football". SHARE
